greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of P_{3,2}(8) = Sum 1/p^8 over primes == 2 (mod 3).
comment: The prime zeta modulo function P_{m,r}(s) = Sum_{primes p == r (mod m)} 1/p^s generalizes the prime zeta function P(s) = Sum_{primes p} 1/p^s.
link: R. J. Mathar, Table of Dirichlet L-series and Prime Zeta Modulo Functions for Small Moduli, arXiv:1008.2547 [math.NT], 2010-2015, value P(m=3, n=2, s=8), p. 21.
OEIS index to entries related to the (prime) zeta function.
program: (PARI) A343618_upto(N=100)={localprec(N+5); digits((PrimeZeta32(8)+1)\.1^N)[^1]} \\ see A343612 for the function PrimeZeta32
xref: Cf. A343628 (for primes 3k+1), A086038 (for primes 4k+1), A085997 (for primes 4k+3).
results.author: _M. F. Hasler_, Apr 25 2021
